author: Murcia.com
title: Brilla tu luz lleg√≥ a los √°ngeles, reuniendo a celebridades y l√≠deres para crear conciencia contra el antisemitismo - Empresa - murcia.com
text: Brilla Tu Luz (SHINE a Light), es la iniciativa organizada junto a FUENTE LATINA para combatir el antisemitismo y la discriminaci√≥n, elementos que se han incrementado y van desafortunadamente en ascenso. El pasado 13 de diciembre se reunieron en la ciudad de Los √Ångeles, diversas personalidades, celebridades y l√≠deres para apoyar esta causa y conocer un poco m√°s acerca de la historia de lucha y discriminaci√≥n sistem√°tica que han recibido los jud√≠os en el mundo. Celebridades como el renombrado Bernard Hiller coach de Hollywood, Miss Venezuela 2019 Isbel Parra, los actores Edgardo Gazc√≥n, Ricardo Ch√°vez, Luis de Ita, chef Franco, el cantante Gerardo Fern√°ndez hermano de Pedro Fern√°ndez, Roxana Silva cantante peruana, la presentadora Jackeline Cacho, cineasta Vicky Contreras, el artista Marcos D‚ÄôOne, entre otros l√≠deres y figuras del mundo de la televisi√≥n se han unido a esta iniciativa para crear conciencia y buscar unir nuestras comunidades en lugar de dividirlas. Comunidades como los latinos, africanos, asi√°ticos tambi√©n se han visto afectados en los √∫ltimos a√±os donde SHINE a Light #BrillaTuLuz busca atacar el antisemitismo por medio de informaci√≥n y educaci√≥n, un problema muy grande debido a la desinformaci√≥n y un algoritmo en las redes sociales que promueve el odio. ‚ÄúEste evento nos ayuda a concientizar lo vivido y hacer un llamado de atenci√≥n ya que han ocurrido m√°s de 2,000 ataques en contra de jud√≠os en Estados Unidos; y muchos de estos han ocurrido en California y en Los √Ångeles‚Äù coment√≥ Leah Soibel, fundadora de Fuente Latina. Por su parte Alec Gancman, sobreviviente del Holocausto, quien naci√≥ en Rusia, creci√≥ en Uruguay y vive en Los √Ångeles, comenta que este evento ayudar√° a educar y valorar lo vivido para concientizar a la juventud, donde tambi√©n hace un llamado a la educaci√≥n en escuelas para aprender todo lo vivido en el holocausto y que esto no se vuelva a repetir.

author: Sharon Liao
title: 7 Diet Moves That Are Natural Energy Boosters - Consumer Reports
text:
It‚Äôs the time of year when many people vow to adopt better eating habits. But despite making a sincere effort, most don‚Äôt reach their goal. Why? They think that eating healthier means overhauling everything.
More on Healthy Eating How to Choose a Good Extra Virgin Olive Oil Is Green Juice Good for You? The Best-Tasting Canned Beans Finding the Best Pasta Sauce The Truth About 'Natural' Sweeteners The truth is, even little tweaks in your meals can have a significant impact on your energy, mood, and overall well-being. ‚ÄúSmall, manageable changes are sustainable, and they give you a sense of success that keeps you motivated,‚Äù says Dolores Woods, a registered dietitian at UTHealth Houston School of Public Health.
The rewards can be huge. A study published in 2021 in the journal Nature Food found that trading just 10 percent of your daily calories from beef and processed meats to more nutritious foods, such as fruits, vegetables, beans, and fish, can increase your healthy life span. So you may not only live longer but also extend the amount of time you live free of serious illness. For someone eating 2,000 calories, that means trading just 200 calories‚Äîroughly one snack or side dish a day. Want to try this and our other expert-advised ideas? Start the year off right by making a few small changes every day.
Healthy Up Your Breakfast We tend to lose muscle and strength with age, but getting enough protein can help protect against this, Woods says. Plus, protein takes longer to break down than carbs, which slows the release of blood sugar. According to a 2017 study in the American Journal of Clinical Nutrition , people who had a high-protein breakfast (30 percent of calories from protein) experienced a better insulin response and blood glucose level after 4 hours compared with those who had mostly carbs.
Yet nearly half of older adults don‚Äôt get the recommended 0.36 gram of protein per pound of body weight per day (54 grams for a 150-pound person). To get a head start, add some protein to your morning meal. Top toast with cottage cheese or an egg, stir nut butter into oatmeal, or pair cereal with Greek yogurt and chia seeds. Bonus: You‚Äôll feel fuller and have a steady supply of energy throughout the morning.
Try New Grains It‚Äôs no secret that whole grains are healthier, with more fiber and B vitamins, than refined ones. This extra nutrition is particularly important for older adults. A study published in 2021 in The Journal of Nutrition found that people ages 55 and older who ate at least three servings of whole grains daily had better markers of heart health‚Äîsmaller increases in waist size, blood pressure, and blood sugar‚Äîcompared with those who got less than half a serving. Bored with brown rice and oatmeal? Try amaranth , buckwheat, farro, or quinoa.
Add One More Fruit or Vegetable to Your Plate While experts recommend five or more servings of produce a day, even smaller amounts boost heart health. A 2014 study in BMJ found that every extra daily serving‚Äîup to five‚Äîslashes the risk of dying of heart disease by 4 percent. Each fruit and vegetable contains its own combination of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants that fight inflammation , says Judy Simon, a registered dietitian with the University of Washington.
For the biggest benefit, choose an assortment of colorful fruits and vegetables. According to 2023 research in The Journal of Nutrition , people over age 50 who consumed the biggest variety of produce were 21 percent less likely to die from heart disease over a 15-year span compared with those who had the least. Simon suggests tossing extra veggies into your main course. You can also add greens to soups and sandwiches, broccoli or cauliflower in stir-fries, and mushrooms, peppers, or zucchini to pasta dishes.
Eat Your Greens First Leafy greens help protect brain health , broccoli and brussels sprouts are potential cancer preventers, and green peas can improve digestive health. So when you sit down to a meal, start with your greens to make sure you‚Äôre getting them in your diet, Woods says. Plus, eating veggies before the rest of your meal can lower your blood sugar response afterward, according to scientists from Cornell University. This may help people with prediabetes and diabetes‚Äîclose to half of Americans‚Äîkeep their conditions in check.
Learn About Labels ‚ÄúMade with whole grains‚Äù and ‚Äúmultigrain‚Äù products are often made with mainly refined white flour. Look for the words ‚Äú 100% whole grains ,‚Äù says Vijaya Surampudi, MD, an associate professor of medicine at the UCLA Center for Human Nutrition. ‚ÄúOr check that a whole grain is listed as the first ingredient.‚Äù
Snack on Nuts Many snack staples, such as pretzels, cereal bars, and crackers, are highly processed. A diet high in these packaged foods is linked to type 2 diabetes, heart disease, obesity, and dementia. But a review of research published in the journal Antioxidants suggests a diet high in nuts can protect against conditions like these. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre high in healthy fats, fiber, vitamins, and minerals,‚Äù Simon says. Aim for an ounce‚Äîabout a handful‚Äîof nuts a day.
Pair Treats With Healthy Foods You don‚Äôt need to give up ice cream and chips, Simon says. Serve yourself a small portion with food that‚Äôs high in fiber or protein. Top ice cream with fresh fruit, dip chips into hummus, and mix chocolate with nuts. These additions slow the release of sugar into the bloodstream, she says, which can stave off a blood sugar spike and the energy crash that follows.
Editor‚Äôs Note: A version of this article also appeared in the January 2024 issue of Consumer Reports On Health .

author: Steven Walgenbach
title: Crypto Fear And Greed Index Hits Lowest Since October As Bitcoin Sinks Below $92K
text:
The Crypto Fear and Greed Index plummeted to its lowest level since Oct. 14 after Bitcoin‚Äôs price plunged below $92K yesterday.
The Index stands at 50, signaling ‚ÄúNeutral‚Äù sentiment in the crypto market, after a 19-point drop over the past day.
Bitcoin Makes A Slight Recovery As Crypto Fear And Greed Index Shifts From ‚ÄúGreed‚Äù To ‚ÄúNeutral‚Äù The recent drop in the Crypto Fear and Greed Index also marks a 24-point drop over the past 7 days, as crypto investor sentiment shifts from ‚ÄúGreed‚Äù to ‚ÄúNeutral.‚Äù After falling to a 24-hour low of $91,220.84 in the last trading session, BTC has since been able to recover to trade at $94,093.96 as of 1:45 a.m. EST.
üìä #Crypto Fear and Greed Index
üß≠ Index Value : 50
üò± Sentiment : Neutral
üí∞ $BTC pic.twitter.com/rRbASbB0K0
‚Äî Crypto with Ankit (@Cryptowithankit) January 10, 2025
Despite the recovery, the leading crypto is still down over the past 24 hours, and is more than 2% in the red on the 7-day time frame.
Bitcoin‚Äôs recent pullback comes after the US government received the greenlight to sell $6.5 billion worth of Bitcoin that was seized from darknet marketplace Silk Road.
Analysts also say that the drop in the BTC price is being triggered by growing uncertainty over how much scope the US Federal Reserve has to cut interest rates this year.
Cardano The Only Top 10 Crypto To Record A 24-hour Gain Many other crypto majors followed BTC‚Äôs lead and suffered 24-hour losses. Only Cardano (ADA) was able to withstand the selling pressure to record a minor gain in the last day.
Altcoin leader Ethereum (ETH), remittance token XRP and leading meme coin Dogecoin (DOGE) all saw their prices retrace more than 1%. Tron (TRX), the 10th largest crypto by market cap, took the biggest hit in the top 10 list after losing over 2% in the last 24 hours.

author: Mookie Alexander
title: Why the Steelers are the unchecked box on the Geno Smith revenge tour - Field Gulls
text: Fate works in mysterious ways, doesn‚Äôt it? Last year, [Seattle Seahawks](https://www.fieldgulls.com/) quarterbacks Geno Smith notched nothing but wins against his three previous teams, culminating in the mathematical elimination of his original team, the [New York Jets](https://www.ganggreennation.com/). He followed that up with a season-extending overtime win over the [Los Angeles Rams](https://www.turfshowtimes.com/), whom he played his first non-garbage time snaps against in place of the injured Russell Wilson back in 2021. This year, again with the playoffs on the line, the Smith revenge tour has one more stop to make. In the penultimate week of the regular season, Geno will face the [Pittsburgh Steelers](https://www.behindthesteelcurtain.com/), the same team whom he faced in his first Seahawks start on Sunday Night Football. The eventual glimpse into the post-Wilson era was not promising. A bizarrely pass-heavy 1st half saw Smith throw for just 8/14 for 63 yards, with 0 points scored and only 3 first downs achieved. The pass-run ratio was 80-20 for no particularly good reason. First-year offensive coordinator Shane Waldron changed things up at halftime, opting to establish the run to the Nth degree. The late Alex Collins stormed out of the gates with 56 rushing yards on 8 carries, fittingly scoring Seattle‚Äôs first touchdown. He would finish with 101 yards on 20 carries, the final 100-yard game of his career. A 10-play, 75-yard‚Äî NFL (@NFL) [@Seahawks]TD drive cuts the Steelers lead in half. : [#SEAvsPIT]on NBC : NFL app [pic.twitter.com/XjzXncW5tm] [October 18, 2021] The next scoring drive was all about Geno and tight ends Gerald Everett and Will Dissly. Gerald Everett channeling BeastMode.‚Äî NFL (@NFL) [#Seahawks] : [#SEAvsPIT]on NBC : NFL app [pic.twitter.com/x9JT1Nc1a6] [October 18, 2021] Dissly Dissly!‚Äî NFL (@NFL) [@Seahawks]pull within 3. [#Seahawks] : [#SEAvsPIT]on NBC : NFL app [pic.twitter.com/KmYeddPck3] [October 18, 2021] [An interception bouncing off](https://www.fieldgulls.com/2021/10/17/22732221/jamal-adams-flubs-chance-to-make-game-changing-pick?utm_campaign=fieldgulls&utm_content=chorus&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter) of Jamal Adams‚Äô helmet opened the door for Pittsburgh to retake the lead at 20-17, setting the stage for Geno‚Äôs game-tying or game-winning drive. It was apparent that Seattle leaned towards the field goal, although DK Metcalf‚Äôs incredibly risky attempt to score a touchdown almost wrecked the entire mission. Madness on this play.‚Äî NFL (@NFL) [@Seahawks]get into field goal range with seconds left. : [#SEAvsPIT]on NBC : NFL app [pic.twitter.com/xKD5WbIfKH] [October 18, 2021] In overtime, Geno had two chances to lead Seattle to an unlikely road win in Pittsburgh. Unfortunately, TJ Watt got in the way. ELECTRIC.‚Äî NFL (@NFL) [@_TJWatt] : [#SEAvsPIT]on NBC : NFL app [pic.twitter.com/bFVIv4fu6R] [October 18, 2021] TJ WATT FORCES THE FUMBLE.‚Äî NFL (@NFL) [#HereWeGo] : [#SEAvsPIT]on NBC : NFL app [pic.twitter.com/SbUBpLy0qI] [October 18, 2021] Current Seahawks linebacker Devin Bush corrected himself to run the right way on the fumble recovery. Game, set, and match. Geno‚Äôs only ‚Äúturnover-worthy play‚Äù on the night was an actual turnover, and it essentially lost the game. ‚ÄúI hate coming up short,‚Äù Smith said [after the loss]. ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt keep coming up short. I can‚Äôt keep coming up short. I put that on myself. Back to back weeks, our defense gives us a chance to go out there and score. Give me the ball and we don‚Äôt get it done. That‚Äôs solely on me, and I vow to be better.‚Äù Smith finished 23/32 for 209 yards and a touchdown, with an average depth of target at 4.1 yards, the second shortest of all of his Seahawks starts. The plan was safe and conservative‚Äîthe four screen passes went for -1 yard‚Äîperhaps indicative of both Geno as the then-backup and the state of Seattle‚Äôs offensive line. These were the Seahawks‚Äô starters that day: Left Tackle: Duane Brown Left Guard: Damien Lewis Center: Kyle Fuller Right Guard: Gabe Jackson Right Tackle: Brandon Shell Extra Offensive Lineman: Jamarco Jones Geno was sacked 5 times on 11 pressures. Not only is Lewis the only starter still with the Seahawks, he‚Äôs the only one who‚Äôs even on an active NFL 53-man roster. Brown just went to IR on the New York Jets, Fuller is in the USFL, Jackson is on the [Carolina Panthers](https://www.catscratchreader.com/) practice squad, Shell retired, and Jones is unsigned. What a difference two years makes. The 2023 edition of Steelers vs. Seahawks is sort of a playoff eliminator for Pittsburgh and a must-have for Seattle in order to stay in a wild card spot. It‚Äôs Geno‚Äôs chance to even the score and put his team one step closer to another postseason berth. Ideally, for a change, a last-minute drive will not be required to win. If that‚Äôs what it comes to, I think Smith has shown enough in his two seasons as a starter to indicate that he‚Äôs capable of delivering in the clutch.
